definition[0]: to become less severe or harmful
example[0]: The wind had dropped and the rain gradually let up.
definition[1]: to be less severe, unkind, or violent towards someone
example[1]: Even when the crowd had scattered, the police didn’t let up.
definition[2]: to stop working as hard as you were
example[2]: You’re doing really well, but you can’t afford to let up now.
definition[3]: when something unpleasant stops or becomes less difficult, severe etc
example[3]: The pressure at work continued without any let-up.
example[4]: Streets were flooded, but still there was no let-up in the rain.
